description: The 35-year-old heartthrob had never met the 34-year-old pop diva before they shared the stage
title: Lip Sync Battle champ Channing Tatum says meeting Beyoncé as her was terrifying
title_page: Lip Sync Battle champ Channing Tatum says meeting Beyoncé as her was terrifying | Daily Mail Online
text:
Lip Sync Battle champ Channing Tatum recalled his awkward yet transcendent triumph with Beyoncé on Thursday's episode of The Ellen DeGeneres Show.
'I had never met her before. I won't even tell you what I had to do to essentially get her assistant's phone number,' the 35-year-old heartthrob recalled.
'I didn't even have the intention of her coming...I wanted to bring like a cardboard cut-out of Beyoncé out just to be funny, and then ultimately I ended up having to meet Beyoncé doing Beyoncé and that was definitely the most terrifying thing I've ever done.'
Scroll down for video
Birthday bouquet for Ellen: Lip Sync Battle champ Channing Tatum recalled his awkward yet transcendent triumph with Beyoncé on Thursday's episode of The Ellen DeGeneres Show
2.5M viewers tuned into to watch the Hateful Eight actor mime the 34-year-old pop diva's 2011 hit, Run the World (Girls).
Channing then compared the 20-time Grammy winner to the mysterious mastermind Keyser Söze in the 1995 flick The Usual Suspects.
'I said, "Hi!" And she goes, "Hey, that was really funny. See ya!" But she did text afterwards and she was like, "Hey I would love to meet you guys and hang out when you're not looking like me and so terrifying.'
The 35-year-old heartthrob recalled: 'I had never met her before. I won't even tell you what I had to do to essentially get her assistant's phone number'
He continued: 'Ultimately I ended up having to meet Beyoncé doing Beyoncé and that was definitely the most terrifying thing I've ever done'

'She goes, "Hey, that was really funny. See ya!"' Channing then compared the 20-time Grammy winner to the mysterious mastermind Keyser Söze in the 1995 flick The Usual Suspects
The Magic Mike XXL hunk also discussed how stubborn his two-year-old daughter Everly is with him and his wife Jenna Dewan.
'She just wants to stay in her PJs or naked all day,' Tatum told the host - who turned 58 on Tuesday.
'I get it, I get it, which always feels very hypocritical because I go, "You have to wear clothes. We all wear clothes." And she's just like, "Nope. Nope, not doing that" and I'm like, "Well, okay." You just go with it.'

The former male stripper spent three months preparing to play a Gene Kelly-style hoofer called Burt Gurney in the Coen Brothers' Hail, Caesar!
The fifties Hollywood comedy - also starring George Clooney, Josh Brolin, and Scarlett Johansson - hits US theaters February 5 and UK theaters March 4
